ai_analysis.summary: Due to the payer’s prior escalation (escalate_count = 1), this money order must be rejected per policy override, despite a low ML fraud score.
reasoning: Payer-Based Escalation Policy: The customer has an escalate_count of 1, triggering a mandatory REJECT override regardless of other indicators.
Signature Validation: Signature field is present and non-empty, so no signature-related rejection is required.
ML Model Results: Fraud Risk Score is 0.0% with 0.0% confidence, indicating no automated alerts, but policy override takes precedence.
Field Consistency: Amount numeric (USD 325.00) has no written amount provided, but no mismatches are flagged.
Training Dataset Patterns: Although 45% of frauds involve amount mismatches, no such mismatch is detected here.
Historical Cases: No similar prior cases exist for additional context.
actionable_recommendations: Notify the customer of the rejection and explain the policy regarding prior escalations.
Escalate this case record to the internal fraud review team for monitoring of any related accounts.
Request supporting documentation from the customer for compliance record-keeping.
